Bash(venvScriptspython.exe -c "
import sys; sys.stdout.reconfigure\(encoding=''utf-8''\)
sys.path.insert\(0, ''.''\)

# Test the parser directly with raw Kalshi data
import json, urllib.request
url = ''https://api.elections.kalshi.com/trade-api/v2/markets/KXPOLITICSMENTION-26FEB15-SHUT''
req = urllib.request.Request\(url, headers={''Accept'': ''application/json'', ''User-Agent'': ''homerun/1.0''}\)
with urllib.request.urlopen\(req\) as resp:
    data = json.loads\(resp.read\(\)\)

raw = data[''market'']

# Now test our parser
from services.kalshi_client import KalshiClient
market = KalshiClient._parse_kalshi_market\(raw\)
print\(f''question: {market.question[:80]}''\)
print\(f''group_item_title: ""{market.group_item_title}""''\)
print\(f''tokens: {[\(t.outcome, round\(t.price,3\)\) for t in market.tokens]}''\)
")

Bash("venv/Scripts/python.exe" -c "
import sys; sys.stdout.reconfigure\(encoding=''utf-8''\)
sys.path.insert\(0, ''.''\)

# Check the running server''s actual output
import json, urllib.request

# Also check - fetch a market that we KNOW should have the new format
url = ''http://localhost:8000/api/opportunities''
req = urllib.request.Request\(url\)
with urllib.request.urlopen\(req\) as resp:
    opps = json.loads\(resp.read\(\)\)

# Find a KXPOLITICSMENTION opp
for opp in opps:
    for m in opp[''markets'']:
        if ''KXPOLITICSMENTION'' in str\(m.get\(''id'', ''''\)\):
            print\(f''Server opp id={m[""id""]}''\)
            print\(f''  question: {m[""question""][:80]}''\)
            print\(f''  group_item_title: ""{m.get\(""group_item_title"", """"\)}""''\)
            print\(f''  outcome_labels: {m.get\(""outcome_labels"", []\)}''\)
            print\(\)
")
